title: Lindelof cleared to sign for Man Utd as Benfica agree fee with Swedish club [Expressen]
text:
Lindelof cleared to sign for Man Utd as Benfica agree fee with Swedish club [Expressen] By Paul Morrissey   Lindelof to Man United, on-off-on 
Victor Lindelof’s move to Manchester United has been turned on and off more than a light switch – and now it looks firmly on. 
Given Manchester United’s defensive shortages, Jose Mourinho has been monitoring the Swedish defender for some time, and sent scouts to watch him last December. 
Still just 22 and very inexperienced, Lindelof has been impressing for Portuguese giants Benfica of late, and Mourinho is believed to see him as a long-term defensive solution. 
But after being told that the Swede was set to play his final game for Benfica , and then seeing him sign a Man United shirt, we were then told that the deal had hit a brick wall. 
It was reported last week that Mourinho pulled the plug on the move due to the surprise re-emergence of Phil Jones, who has provided him with additional cover. 
But it now seems Mourinho wanted him all along, and just needed to wait for the red tape to be cleared. Cleared to sign 
Because a disagreement had arisen between Benfica and Lindelof’s former Swedish club, Vasteras, over the sell-on fee the latter would be entitled to in the event of the player moving again; Vasteras want 20% and it seems Benfica have been trying to negotiate a lower percentage. 
According to Swedish paper Expressen , Benfica and Vasteras have now reached an agreement on their payment, meaning Lindelof has the green light for his Old Trafford move. Loading tags...
